WorkItem.Description:
It's about latest version of Irony â€” "Mar 15, 2012"
If we define NumberLiteral and add "0" (zero) as octal prefix:

term.AddPrefix("0", NumberOptions.Octal);

Then single "0" (zero) number won't be parsed, causing "Invalid character: '0'." parser error.
See "MiniPython, version 2.0" if you want to reproduce bug quickly.
WorkItem.Summary: NumberLiteral issue with octal prefix defined

Comments.Message:
looks like an error, will fix it
thanks

It would be really great. Thanks.

Another related issue is that numbers like "08234", that are apparently not an octal ones, are not automatically recognized as decimals. Questionable thing though.
"08234" - i think it should be rejected as syntax error
